responses.rationale: Describes a method being used ('surveil at-risk workers') without active reassurance.
Describes a new program ('pay farmworkers $75 each to be tested', 'offers incentives') without active reassurance.
Describes the purpose of a payment ('compensates workers for their time contributing to the monitoring') without active reassurance.
Contains an explicit low-risk statement ('risk currently poses a low risk to public health').
Statement is a negative comment on the impact of a measure, not a description of a capability/preparedness measure itself.
Describes a potential negative consequence and public reaction (fear).
General historical statement.
Historical example of social impact.
Describes a recommended measure ('Education needs to be a part of testing efforts') without active reassurance.
Describes recommended methods for implementing a measure ('conversations should be conducted in the farmworkers' language') without active reassurance.
Describes a requested action/safeguard ('asked states... to share personal protective equipment') without active reassurance.
Describes implemented action/safeguard ('said they have offered to distribute such equipment') without active reassurance.
Describes uptake of a safeguard ('four dairy farms had requested protective equipment') without active reassurance.
Comments on the nature of a safeguard ('protective equipment offerings need to be practical') without active reassurance.
Suggests a specific safeguard ('Plastic face shields seem like a better option') and its benefit without active reassurance.
Statement of concern/risk factor.
Describes a risk factor/exposure detail.
Factual report of animal deaths.
Factual report of location of deaths.
Factual report of cause of death based on test results.
Headline reporting a factual event (diagnosis).
Factual report of a human case.
Describes a positive outcome for an individual ('successfully treated', 'has since been discharged') without general reassurance.

Attribution statement.

Public health advice/recommendation ('avoid raw milk and raw milk products') without active reassurance.
Contains an explicit low-risk statement ('the general public’s risk is low').
Caption describing a photo related to animal cases.
Describes a deficiency in a tracking method ('leaving the federal government without the data necessary') without active reassurance.

Statement of attention/focus.

Describes ongoing work ('working on building up their muscles for communicating') without active reassurance.
Describes the introduction of a bill ('is introducing a bill today that would ban') without active reassurance.

Describes the motivation/goal of the bill.
Statement of opinion/advocacy.
Describes discussions about advancing a candidate ('in discussions... on advancing our pandemic flu candidate') without active reassurance.
Statement of commitment/intent ('remain committed to using our mRNA platform to respond') without active reassurance.
Describes a characteristic of vaccines in trial ('H5 vaccines in its trial cover the same virus family') without active reassurance.
